data.title: Fix WindowsUniversal nuspec
data.body:
As stated in #4515, this pull removes the reference, and also updates the readme
Remove SharpDX.XInput.dll reference from
MonoGame.Framework.WindowsUniversal.nuspec
Update contents of Readme-Build.txt

data.title: Keep or Remove PerformanceCounter

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
I ran into this random class in MonoGame tonight `PerformanceCounter`:

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/0b25f56e861fb602db884c40267b99ea947bae15/MonoGame.Framework/PerformanceCounter.cs

Should we remove this?  Should we keep it and improve it?

IMO the class needs to be good enough to be used within MonoGame itself if we want to keep it.  It has to be easy to turn on/off... ideally at runtime... with zero cost when off.

data.title: [Pipeline] FilterView for Shader warnings/errors
[Linux Installer] Disable copying of nvtt libs
data.body: This was needed because when I compiled nvtt libs, I didn't know about rpath, and left it to default(which was my home path), @KonajuGames recompiled them so this is no longer needed.

data.title: NuGet Automation Failing
data.body:
Looks like our NuGet packaging has been failing since December and no one has noticed or reported it.  You can see here how the last updated package was December 15th:

  http://teamcity.monogame.net/guestAuth/app/nuget/v1/FeedService.svc/Packages

The error in the logs show is:

```
Starting NuGet.exe 2.8.60318.667 from C:\BuildAgent\tools\NuGet.CommandLine.DEFAULT.nupkg\tools\NuGet.exe
Attempting to build package from 'MonoGame.Framework.WindowsUAP.nuspec'.
File not found: 'WindowsUAP\AnyCPU\Release\SharpDX.XInput.dll'.
Process exited with code 1
```

http://teamcity.monogame.net/viewLog.html?guest=1&buildId=14560&buildTypeId=MonoGame_Automation_NuGetDevelop&tab=buildLog

I'm not sure if this is something wrong with the build or something wrong with the NuGet package definition.

Secondarily we need to make errors in NuGet packaging more visible.  Might need to have that specific email myself and @KonajuGames to alert someone of the issue.

data.title: Added a Visual Studio 2015 Project Template for Windows 10 UAP in VB
data.body: Recently a few people have been trying to get MonoGame up and running using VB. This project template provides an easy way to do that.

data.title: Fix exit crash on Windows native desktopGL
data.body:
When DesktopGL uses the native backend on Windows, `OpenTKGameWindow.OnResize()` may be called with a null `GraphicsDevice` upon exit.

Just a little null check so that it doesn't crash.

data.title: [Win Pipeline] Fix Multiselect Undo/Redo
Added nuget for DesktopGL
Update the build script to download the Archived Android and OUYA
data.body:
binaries from the MacBuild bot. If it can.

We'll need to update the MacBot to archive these files.

data.title: Change the XS ProjectTemplates to use the Local Installed Assemblies.
data.body:
Using the Nuget packages for the templates was a hack to work around
issues with Assembly resolution in Xamarin Studios/MonoDevelop.
With the changes to the MonoGameMSBuildImports class we can now
correctly inject the HintPath to pick up the local assemblies. This
will allow develop builds to actually reference the installed assemblies
rather than an out of date nuget package.

We do this by having a new msbuild .props file

```
MonoGame.Common.props
```

This file is responsible for finding the correct Instllation path,
all the VS templates have been updated to use this new file and the
old settings to <MonoGameInstallDirectory> have been removed.
The XS templates will also get this new import when they are first loaded.

NOTE : the Import MUST be the first item in the project. This is to the
directory is resolved BEFORE the assemblies are loaded.

data.title: Updated Xamarin Studio Shared project to include a Content.mgcb
data.body:
this is because it now works with the Content Pipleine on Mac.

Added a Stand Alone Shared Project for Visual Studio to Mirror the
one in Xamarin studio.

Note : For some reason even though we have the Content.mgcb added as
a item in the shared project Visual Studio does NOT show it. However
it DOES still pick it up and compile it via MGCB.exe

data.title: refactor of wiki page to doc page
data.body:
Moved text from wiki concerning Android manifest requirements and added
to Platform specific notes for Android.

My first PR ever. I hope this works.

data.title: Fix casing in MonoGame.Tests project definition
data.body:
When building on case sensitive platforms, the build fails because the MonoGame.Tests project has a casing that differs from the filenames on disk, which results in these build errors:

```
/usr/lib/mono/xbuild/12.0/bin/Microsoft.Common.targets: error : Cannot copy /srv/leases/workingcopy-26560/repo/monogame/Test/Assets/Fonts/MotorWerk.xnb to /srv/leases/workingcopy-26560/repo/monogame/Test/bin/Windows/AnyCPU/Release/Assets/Fonts/MotorWerk.xnb, as the source file doesn't exist.
797     /usr/lib/mono/xbuild/12.0/bin/Microsoft.Common.targets: error : Cannot copy /srv/leases/workingcopy-26560/repo/monogame/Test/Assets/Textures/Logo555.bmp to /srv/leases/workingcopy-26560/repo/monogame/Test/bin/Windows/AnyCPU/Release/Assets/Textures/Logo555.bmp, as the source file doesn't exist.
798     /usr/lib/mono/xbuild/12.0/bin/Microsoft.Common.targets: error : Cannot copy /srv/leases/workingcopy-26560/repo/monogame/Test/Assets/Textures/Logo565.bmp to /srv/leases/workingcopy-26560/repo/monogame/Test/bin/Windows/AnyCPU/Release/Assets/Textures/Logo565.bmp, as the source file doesn't exist.
799 
```

Instead, set the casing in the definition to match the name of the files on disk.

data.title: Fix inaccessible GetGuid for OpenTK on Linux / DesktopGL
data.body:
On Linux / DesktopGL, this method is inaccessible under OpenTK, and results in:

```
Input/Joystick.OpenTK.cs(29,44): error CS0122: `OpenTK.Input.Joystick.GetGuid(int)' is inaccessible due to its protection level
```

when building either the Linux or WindowsGL projects.  On these platforms, default to an empty string instead.

data.title: Pipeline tool can't find Freetype6.dll
data.body:
When trying to build a spritefont in the content pipeline, it fails because it can't find the freetype6.dll, despite this .dll being in the monogame tools folder. I have tried multiple versions, and all of them have this issue.

This is the message when building the font:

Building Font C:\WINDOWS\Fonts\arial.ttf
System.DllNotFoundException: Unable to load DLL 'freetype6.dll': The specified module could not be found. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x8007007E)
   at SharpFont.FT.FT_Init_FreeType(IntPtr& alibrary)
   at SharpFont.Library..ctor()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.SharpFontImporter.Import(FontDescription options, String fontName)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.FontDescriptionProcessor.ImportFont(FontDescription options, Single& lineSpacing, Int32& yOffsetMin, ContentProcessorContext context, String fontName)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.FontDescriptionProcessor.Process(FontDescription input, ContentProcessorContext context)

data.title: Fix Content Building on Mac
data.body:
At the moment 64 bit mono is not really available,
it is still in preview. So we need to disable this
64Bit check for Mac (and Linux) until its in stable.

data.title: Property changes with multiple objects selected is not undo-able.
data.body:
The winforms propertygrid natively supports selecting more than one object, and being able to set a given property on them all at the same time if that property is the same type/name. 

However, the only event it exposes for responding to such a change is OnPropertyValueChanged which occurs after the new value is already set, and does not pass what the previous value was, if there is more than one object selected.

So, implementing this means we probably need to store the state of all objects in the selection, whenever the selection is changed, then push THAT state into the undo/redo object when OnPropertyValueChanged occurs.

data.title: Fix mouse coordinate for DesktopGL and windowed mode
data.body:
`OpenTK.Input.Mouse.GetCursorState()` and `OpenTK.Input.Mouse.GetState()` both return coordinates relatively to the drawing surface. The current mouse code assume them to be relative to the display, and not the drawing surface, and tries to adjust them with the window's position. This was causing mouse coordinates to be wrong when using windowed.

This PR fixes this behavior.

However, OpenTK doesn't provide methods to get the mouse position relatively to the display, and therefore `Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.Mouse.GetState(GameWindow window)` can't return coordinates specific to a `GameWindow` and will always return them relatively to the active OpenTK surface.

@cra0zy @dellis1972

data.title: CONTRIBUTING.md Rewrite
data.body:
This is a rewrite of the CONTRIBUTING.md document to better guide contributors on how the project works, what we expect of contributions, and general dos and don'ts.

You can more easily read the document here:

  https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/mdfixes/CONTRIBUTING.md

I tried to keep it short and simple to read while including most of the critical information.

data.title: Vector3::Transform bug
Ogg end of stream fix
Why can't IndexBuffer or VertexBuffer be resized?
data.body:
I just thought this writing yet another pattern where I need to grow an index/vertex buffer based on the amount of stuff to draw.

Why can't `IndexBuffer` or `VertexBuffer` be resized ... or even textures or render targets?  Is there some benefit to them being immutable on size and not content?

It seems in cases where you need to resize one... disposing the C# type is just generating more garbage.  It is the internal GPU structures which possibly need recreation...  not the C# type itself.

data.title: Update texture compression in content build pipeline for Mac and Linux
data.body:
Revert back to NVTT for DXT. More reliable on Mac and Linux, but a lot slower.
Update PVRTexLibNET and PVRTexLibWrapper.
Remove use of internal global variable in PVRTexLibNET.

data.title: Clean up some code that potentially was reflected.
data.body:
After an incident with a contributor and auditing their contributions we
have a strong suspicion that some bits of their code came from either a
copyrighted source or from a reflection tool.

While we do not have definitive proof of this and cannot be certain of
the code's origin, we feel it is just better for the project to remove
those chunks of code.

 The code in question is in the following functions:
- BoundingFrustum.Intersects(ref Ray ray, out float? result)
- Vector4.Transform(ref Vector2 value, ref Quaternion rotation, out Vector4 result)
- Vector4.Transform(ref Vector3 value, ref Quaternion rotation, out Vector4 result)
- Vector4.Transform(ref Vector4 value, ref Quaternion rotation, out Vector4 result)

We hope that someone in the community can contribute their own implementations
to fix these holes soon (of course without reading or reusing any of the code removed in this PR).

We will also follow up with an update to the existing CONTRIBUTING.md to help further clarify what we require from them.

data.title: Remove VertexPosition2ColorTexture add VertexPosition
data.body:
I think we can remove the unused `VertexPosition2ColorTexture` type...

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/Vertices/VertexPosition2ColorTexture.cs

This I think is a legacy type left around from some old "optimization" in `SpriteBatch`.  I don't think anything uses it anymore.

At the same time we should consider adding a `VertexPosition` type.  This is the most basic type supported by `BasicEffect`:

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/Effect/Resources/Structures.fxh#L11

And there has never been a built in type in XNA for this, but I think there should be.

@KonajuGames  @dellis1972 ?

data.title: Texture2D FromStream tests and message
data.body:
First pass at adding a tests to `Texture2D.FromStream` as commented in #4479.
Enveloped `Texture2D.FromStream` in a try-catch block, inside the catch I am throwing a new NotSupportedException with the original one inside and the message "Image type not supported"
Add test class `Texture2DNonVisual` to test project with tests for filetypes: bmp, dds, gif, jpg, png, tiff and tga. All assets reused from other tests.

I have tested this in Windows with the Windows solution and adapted the tests to it (only the tga image provokes an exception), let's see if the other platforms have the same capabilities.

data.title: [SDL] Fix window not getting centered after leaving fullscreen
data.body: I also made sure this works correctly with multiple displays :)

data.title: Removed state check to force stop playing instances
data.body:
This PR removes the `SoundEffectInstance.State` check from the disposing mechanism of the `SoundEffectInstancePool`. This was causing problem to the OpenAL implementation because its `SoundEffectInstance.PlatformGetState()` was internally updating the state, which was making the pool to think that some instances were wrongly stopped, preventing them from freeing their OpenAL source.
This rare scenario ended up in an AL crash in `SoundEffect.Dispose()` because the sound buffer was still bound to a `SoundEffectInstance`.

This change doesn't affect other implementations.

Ping @dellis1972 :)

data.title: WinDX: Fixed GDI leak in GraphicsAdapter.CurrentDisplayMode
data.body:
Today I got a crash report with the following exception:

```
Type: System.ArgumentException
Message: Parameter is not valid.
Source: System.Drawing
Stack Trace:
at System.Drawing.Graphics.GetHdc()
at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsAdapter.get_CurrentDisplayMode()
...
```

Turns out there was a bit of a GDI leak in `GraphicsAdapter.CurrentDisplayMode`. The main problem was that a `Graphics` object was being created (via `Graphics.FromHwnd(IntPtr.Zero)`) but wasn't being disposed. This meant that the resources weren't being released until the garbage collector kicked in. So calling `CurrentDisplayMode` a lot could eventually lead to the above crash.

The fix was as simple as wrapping the `Graphics` object in a `using` so that it got disposed.
